TopicTitle: just a thanks to all mod creators out there

Articles.Content:
hi all I just recently learned about the ckan project and got stuck in

and well that got my mods list up to about 27 form the 6 I had to manually install previously and man what a game changer.![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

I am finally able to play the game I want when this was fist released....and that got me thinking. 

Over 45 versions and 5 years in the running and well mods have always been there they have been a crucial part of this game making it a bigger success than it could have been on its own but that aside I suddenly realized that for 5 years and over 45 versions some mods just kept getting updated and THAT is a GARGANTUAN task 

one that I feel I need to say thank you, for if it was not for the mods I play with I would have quit playing some time ago so 

THANK YOU 

Seriously for all the hard work for all the updates for enduring all the criticisms and the disappointments and for sticking it through.

I not only commend you but thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping me create the ksp experience I needed and wanted. 

More so for doing it for free I used to be a volunteer so I know what a sacrifice you guys make.

I can only join in.

All the modders do great work and enable us, the players and beneficiaries, to piece together the game we like to have.

Although KSP is a great game, I don't think I will ever play it again without mods.

So from me too a big shoutout: THANK YOU

Gratitude is awesome. And KSP modders are awesome and deserve all the gratitude.

Especially the poor devils who have to maintain MechJeb.
+1 thanks to all the hard-working modders! The game wouldn't be what it is without you guys and girls!
I absolutely agree ... several mods have greatly contributed to keeping my interest up in KSP ... thanks
I'm on the same page. Seeing some of the incredible mods people have made, it's kind of inspirational. Kudos to all modders who checked out this forum today, saw this thread, and read this post!
